alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 2:26PM CDT until April 07 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant affecting Elmore and Montgomery Counties. .Heavy rainfall today combined with gate operations at Martin Dam will produce significant rises along the Tallapoosa River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Tallapoosa River at the Water Plant. Another statement will be issued by late tonight, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Lower Wetumpka Road starts to flood. Extensive flooding of low lands occurs and livestock and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 28.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
